N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 447.3 - Exceptions

State Regulations
(a) The department may grant an exception to
compliance with one or more provisions of section
447.2
of this Part upon finding
that compliance will result in undue hardship upon an agency boarding home. The
authorized agency applying for the exception must demonstrate that, aside from
the exception, the agency boarding home is in substantial compliance with the
provisions of section
447.2
of this Part and that
granting the exception will not create any hazardous conditions which could
impair the health or safety of the children. An agency boarding home must
comply with any alternative requirements the department may consider necessary
for the protection of the health or safety of the children. All exceptions must
be requested by the authorized agency in writing and approved by the department
in writing. (b) The provisions of
this Part that become effective September 1, 1994 shall apply to those agency
boarding homes established on or after such date. If compliance with any of the
provisions of this Part that become effective September 1, 1994 creates an
undue hardship for any agency boarding home in operation prior to such date, the agency boarding home must, within one year of such date, submit to the
department a schedule indicating when the agency boarding home will achieve
compliance with such provision. The compliance schedule is subject to approval
by the department and compliance with all provisions of this Part that become
effective September 1, 1994 must be achieved within five years of such
date. Notes
